text: Passover is an unincorporated community in Camden County, in the U.S. state of Missouri. The location is on a narrow peninsula, jutting north into the Grandglaize Creek Arm in the southeastern portion of the Lake of the Ozarks. The community is approximately three miles north of Missouri Route A on a county road.Toronto, MO, 7.5 Minute Topographic Quadrangle, USGS, 1983 ==History== A post office called Passover was established in 1901, and remained in operation until 1931. The origin of the name Passover is uncertain. ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in Camden County, Missouri Category:Unincorporated communities in Missouri
title: Passover, Missouri
